website_summaries.verdict: If you are looking for a basic, affordable playset for toddlers that offers appealing features and functions, this is the best choice.
pros: A cute little percussion playset that's ideal for kids as young as 2, thanks to the sturdy pieces, music, and lights
Plays various styles and melodies, and includes drumsticks
cons: It's on the small side, but this is plus for parents who prefer portable toys
A few defective models have been reported

website_summaries.verdict: Good, noisy fun that children will love, but might drive parents crazy!
pros: Light up drum pads and cymbals teach children basic drumming skills
Features a variety of built-in tunes to play along with
Free play option lets children get creative
cons: Figuring out how to select the free play option without a backing track is a little tricky at first

customer_reviews.title: Save your sanity!!!
customer_reviews.text: So wanted to love this. Our little one loves drums, but this thing is the absolute most annoying toy we have ever owned. You cannot just play the drum sounds without incessant, agitating music and talking on in the background the WHOLE time. It is just aweful. I so wish we had gone another route for drums. Toy noises don't usually annoy me either, this one is just really bad. It also doesn't pause the noises when not in use. If it is on, it just keeps going and going and going. My advise, don't do it!! Save your sanity!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product. Would be 5 stars but I didn't ...
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Would be 5 stars but I didn't like that you have to actually push the power button ever time you want to play. My one year old has not mastered that but he loves to bang on this. It is also quite a bit smaller than i was expecting but it is really reactive and sounds pretty good.
customer_reviews.author: Allyuh15

customer_reviews.title: Love, love this item
customer_reviews.text: OMG! My nephew is 18 months old and went crazy over this! He played it for hours Christmas day and at one point he was put down for a nap, but the drum speaks and lights up; as he started to fall asleep, it lit up and said 1,2,3. Come play with me. He stayed lying down, opened one eye, grabbed the nearest drumstick and hit the drum and fell back to sleep. When he awoke, he kept playing with it no matter what other toy he was offered. Love, love this item.
customer_reviews.author: Napsil

customer_reviews.title: One of the best purchases I made this past holiday season!  You WILL NOT REGRET this purchase!  :)
customer_reviews.text: This product's description does not do it justice! It's waaaay more awesome than what they are telling you! My favorite things about this drum set are the fact that it helps your child learn the alphabet and numbers! My son was OBSESSED with this toy until he got all his letters and numbers down! This drum set even expanded his vocabulary! I love this toy and I STRONGLY RECOMMEND this toy for other toddlers and preschoolers! You will not regret this purchase! There is also a volume control button on the bottom that comes in handy when needed! :)
customer_reviews.author: ANGELA ANAYA

customer_reviews.title: This is everything that is bad about kid's toys
customer_reviews.text: This is everything that is bad about kid's toys. No way to use it without constant pre-programmed noise and talking. Child can't even make the connection between their action and the result. Plastic, tinny, noisy - and the one of the pieces did not work. Definitely do not recommend this for any child.
customer_reviews.author: Cy D

customer_reviews.title: our kid seems to like it, but minus one point for
customer_reviews.text: Makes drum noises, our kid seems to like it, but minus one point for: a) making you press the background-music-button over and over to get to 'no background music to the drumming' each time you start it b) there's an annoying voice over guy saying 'Hey just bang those drums! Cmon you can do it!' endlessly when it's on and you can't turn him off as far as I can tell. It's really irritating to listen to, which means you have to shut it off immediately after using it or it just keeps saying 'hey cmon let's drum!'
customer_reviews.author: The Guilty Party

customer_reviews.title: Good for short attention spans
customer_reviews.text: My little is only 10 months. She loves this thing! Nothing keeps her attention like this toy. It’s got a ton of functions on the front. My 7 year old actually loves it to. I often find them both playing with it together in the “follow the beat” function. It’s kind of like simon says. Because I got this before she was walking I didn’t take it out of the box. It’s actually propped up perfectly in there so it’s still in the box. I figure when she wants the drumsticks we will inbox it, but for now her and her brother are having a blast. The only thing I’d change is the volume settings.
customer_reviews.author: Aarons Lady

customer_reviews.title: He colors on it from time to time and then cleans it easily with a baby wipe
customer_reviews.text: My Grandson (almost 2) loves this toy! It has been one of his favorites for a few months now. (He has thrown the drumsticks a few times) It is durable and has several options for play. He colors on it from time to time and then cleans it easily with a baby wipe.
customer_reviews.author: M. Henry

customer_reviews.title: Baby toy not toddler drum set
customer_reviews.text: I was disappointed with this item. We thought that it would have a function that allows children to drum and make drum sounds independently, because that is how the description sounded. However, whenever the child drums music starts up and extra sounds proceed from it and the child isn't able to learn how to drum and do rhythm things by themselves. Even the setting where the child can drum independently has extra sounds after each strike. It is more like a newborn toy than a toddler play drum set. We are only keeping it because my son destroyed the box while he was unwrapping it. It appears to be well made which is why it got two stars.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Meh .. it's ok I guess.
customer_reviews.text: Not a huge fan of this at all. Had high hopes for it, but it's really not that interesting. My biggest issue with this toy is that I can't just freestyle play this without the thing adding it's own rolls and crashes. Freestyle mode is there for a reason and shouldn't interfere with a groove. It just bugs me that it's always adding in sounds you didn't want. My kid doesn't care much, lol .. I do though. The different modes are kinda cool. If you have a kid that loves to whack stuff I'd give it a go, but don't expect anything amazing. It's marginal and doesn't get a lot of use.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for grandparents looking for gifts for the toddlers
customer_reviews.text: This drum set is perfect. Absolutely perfect. Why is it perfect? Because it is a great revenge gift for grandparents to send to their grandchildren! Perfect payback for those nights your kid kept you awake at night because they were out past curfew. I highly recommend noisy gift giving for all grandparents and this drum set fits the bill. The grandprincess adores them and makes a joyful noise with them at every opportunity.
customer_reviews.author: Salzw59

customer_reviews.title: Okay toy for smaller kids
customer_reviews.text: When we first got this I was actually surprised it wasn’t bigger than it was. When we got it my daughter loved it for the first day and after that it is not being used. The learning features on it are decent, but they get board very quickly this toy isn’t one that will last through the year, it only goes a couple things and after that it’s just plain. I would recommend it for smaller children but 3-4 year olds would get bored very quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Cherie

customer_reviews.title: Things happen
customer_reviews.text: Attached picture,s taken after removing drum set from the shipping box , drumsticks and tower were sagging , drum kit was in shipping box upside down from top label side of box. There was no sign of damage to outside or inside of box. Straightened drumsticks and tower as best as possible by hand. Checked function of drum set and it perform,s as stated in the direction,s As my granddaughter,s birthday is tomorrow 2-5-2020 and package was late for delivery to boot went ahead and wrapped it up for her .. Thank,s Jon
customer_reviews.author: Jon Boyd

customer_reviews.title: Fun toy.
customer_reviews.text: It's fun. I wish there was a function to simply hit the drum and have it make the sound of that particular drum. There is a setting that does that but after a couple hits it makes all sorts of other noises. Not really a huge complaint but as an adult it would be fun to play around without it going wacky all the time... It's pretty small in size which is good or bad depending on how you look at it.
customer_reviews.author: watabowtbob

customer_reviews.title: Great noisy toy
customer_reviews.text: We bought this as an annoying noisy gift for a friend. It is perfect. Their son loves it and it is the perfect noisy gift as it doesn't get to the stage where you actually lose friends. We look forward to our sons birthday when we receive the revenge. If the revenge is steep, I will update this review so future buyers are aware of potential drawbacks of buying friends kids such an awesome gift.
customer_reviews.author: Louise

customer_reviews.title: Fun set of drums without the actual noise!
customer_reviews.text: This is an ADORABLE drum set that WON’T get you into trouble!! Perfect toddler sized drums packed with full sized fun! Loads of features and even better is the ability to switch the background sounds off. Variety of ways to play solo/freestyle or follow the lights etc. Size is about as wide as a car seat or a regular sized steering wheel. Drumsticks are a nice wide plastic with super wide,soft, thick rubber tips. Does require 3 AA batteries immediately. This is so much fun and VTech is a great learning game too.
customer_reviews.author: Pyr Lover

customer_reviews.title: Super fun!
customer_reviews.text: I love this toy prolly as much as my daughters! It's super cute i love how it comes in pink and it had so many different options and sounds and games to keep anyone busy for weeks! It is smaller than i originally thought but that's perfectly fine with me and tje kids it makes it easier for them to carry it around with them! All together it was a great purchase and would recommend it to anyone!
customer_reviews.author: Erica

customer_reviews.title: ... one star because OH MY GOD it can get annoying. "Dear
customer_reviews.text: I want to give this thing one star because OH MY GOD it can get annoying. "Dear, can you please try hitting a different part of the daggum toy?" Otherwise, the kiddo loves it and if you really get them to utilize the "drum" sticks, it's an excellent lesson in hand-eye coordination and motor control. -1 star only because it's been used to wake me up during a couch siesta on more than one occasion.
customer_reviews.author: P. Li.

customer_reviews.title: Could be a little better
customer_reviews.text: My son loved it for a bit.... the only problem is that the voice would interrupt his drumming to do some random beat and tell him good job every 4 taps on the drum... so he would keep losing interest when it seems like he is not the one making the noise.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Stone

customer_reviews.title: Five stars!
customer_reviews.text: My 18 month old loves this toy! (of course we have to monitor him closely so he dont try to run with drumstick in his mouth). Easy to play and sound is not too loud (has volume adjustment). Arrived on time as described. Sturdy! Great product! Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: sh

customer_reviews.title: Nice drum set
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my son when he turned one. I figure I buy it before some other person thought they would be funny and buy a kid a drum set. For being a drum set it’s actually pretty small. Which Is good I guess. Not crazy loud either which is nice. I would recommend if your buying this for a actual serious gift. If your looking for trying to be the funny one that buys someone’s child a drum set just so they would annoy and drive the parents crazy this isn’t it. Doesn’t get loud enough for that. Overall decent for the price and seems to be good quality.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan

customer_reviews.title: Kid loved it.
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for 2 year old birthday present and after he opened it he did not want any more presents he just wanted to play with this drum set. I would highly recommend it. The drums also have a volume control so you dont have to listen to them full blast. The learning games on it are fun enough for an adult yet easy enough for small children.
customer_reviews.author: Craig from Maine

customer_reviews.title: Nephew Loved it!
customer_reviews.text: Gave this as an early Christmas gift to my 11 month old nephew. His parents are musical, and his mom was a percussionist as a teenager so thought this would be fun. Biggest hit! Even for his young age he had hours of fun banging on it and making noise with it. Note: The blue things that comes with it that looks like a microphone, it's actually the stand that goes on the bottom. YES, we didn't realize that and it was hysterical! Very happy with this toy.
customer_reviews.author: Andromeda2018

customer_reviews.title: grandson loves this
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for our grandson as part of his toy collection when we were acting as day care. He LOVED this thing. As he got older, he was able to follow along with the counting and beats. He liked changing the drum sound from traditional to various "sounds" and sound effects. My only issue is the volume because the speakers are on the bottom. If it's played on hard floor, that is just fine and it reverberates back..on carpet it is very muffled.
customer_reviews.author: M. D. Flack

customer_reviews.title: Annoying drum
customer_reviews.text: This was for a 2 year old. He loved it. I found it to be quite annoying and you really have no control over the volume it's just loud or louder. If it wasn't switched off and went in the toy box it would randomly go off in the night and scare you. it was very durable and age appropriate.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: It's tiny!
customer_reviews.text: It's so small! I wasn't paying close enough attention when I ordered it and thought it was a decent size...like something my 2 year old could sit in front of and play like a real drum set sized fora toddler. But it's miniature. Seems a lot more fitting for a 6 month old. In fact when my two year old saw it in the box (waiting for me to return it), he said "baby toy?" Two thumbs down.
customer_reviews.author: DwightKSchrute

customer_reviews.title: Complete waste of money.
customer_reviews.text: I am so disappointed in this. Bought this for a Christmas present and it was a complete waste of money. The sound is so low, even on high volume all you hear is the sticks hitting the toy. I could have done better by making my own from cans from my cabinet.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fun toy for all ages!
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my nephew's first birthday present. They came ready to be played with right out of the box, and so I did for about an hour before wrapping them. Although he's still to young to have the sticks, he enjoys it just as much as he would have with the sticks. I hope it will be a toy he can play with for several years. Appears to be durable and I would be surprised if he could figure out how to break it or hurt himself with it.
customer_reviews.author: Kendra Simons

customer_reviews.title: Worth it but very noisy
customer_reviews.text: My 1 year old couldn't care less about this toy. Of course every kid is different. I gave it 4 stars because the product itself is great other than the fact that it makes noise CONSTANTLY unless you turn it off. I wish it were like the other toys where it kind of has a "sleep" mode where it shuts up after so many minutes of non interaction. The frustration free packaging was excellent. I think I had more fun with it than my son. Maybe he'll grow into it.
customer_reviews.author: Emily See

customer_reviews.title: ... for an almost one year old (younger than the recommended age)--it took her a couple of days to warm ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for an almost one year old (younger than the recommended age)--it took her a couple of days to warm up, but she loves them now, and I think the set will become even more fun as she understands just how to use it. You can either freestyle and make your own music or set a beat and play follow-the-leader style. My child isn't old enough to do the latter, but loves to bang on it with her hands and play her own beat. I love that it makes music that makes her squeal with joy, but isn't loud enough to be obnoxious if she plays with it all day!
customer_reviews.author: nybrownie

customer_reviews.title: good until broken
customer_reviews.text: It was good until it was broken by church kids- But they did have fun with it. They had so much fun that the parents wanted the toy to be gone. But eventually it broke down and it is gone. The parents are happy but the children...well...they have new toys so they forgot about their drum set. Still they really enjoyed it. Not sure if a drummer will come out of one of the kids but it was great to see kids have fun banging on stuff. It was either the drum set or the blocks. Too bad the drum set is gone but still it lasted a good time with so much abuse.
customer_reviews.author: P. Kim

customer_reviews.title: More versatile than I thought
customer_reviews.text: Unlike most kids toys with sound, this one doesn't just play the ABC's at your kid when he bumps a button. I like that there is counting up and backwards and the background music can be turned off. It also has a surprisingly good feel for a toy in that it doesn't feel flimsy, but gives a solid thud when you hit the pads. Impressed.
customer_reviews.author: Heartofthematter

customer_reviews.title: a hit with everyone
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my 3yo son's birthday...he loves it...as does his 1yo little brother. Of course we have to supervise the 1yo around the drumsticks which he likes to chew on. With the different challenge modes built in, I think this will continue to be a fun and educational toy for a long time
customer_reviews.author: vtwakeboarder

customer_reviews.title: Noise
customer_reviews.text: Omg this thing is the most annoying thing I have gotten for my 18 month old. Period. I was hoping to just be able to play the drums but there is constantly additional noise and the guys voice is annoying. Kid likes it but really likes the sticks more and bang on other things. Would not recommend. It’s got some fun features but for the most part it’s just constant noise and not a lot of fun drumming.
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: Perfect toddler drum set and it's not too loud
customer_reviews.text: This is great drum set for a young toddler. It has many different settings/variations from prompted drum along to free style and everything in between. It's the perfect size for my 20 month old grandson and the "drums" and "cymbals" make electronically created noises. It's also great for parents because it doesn't take up much space and the sound volume is not very loud so it's very bearable :)
customer_reviews.author: lm

customer_reviews.title: Sorry dad...the kid loves beating on the set
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my 12-month old grandson. It is cute, easy for him to reach, and he loves to beat on the drums, much to the dismay of his dad, my son. Oh well, the kid likes making music. Too bad it is only musical in his own little head. It came with batteries and worked right out of the box. I'm glad I purchased it. I think the kid will use it a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy L. Owens

customer_reviews.title: I love VTech brand and only have positive things to say ...
customer_reviews.text: I love VTech brand and only have positive things to say about them. I first came across this set when searching for toddler instruments. I purchased it for my three year old who really enjoys music. I'm not ready to buy him a full size drum set and wanted to see how he reacted to this first. I love that it's a table/lap top and fits great in the toy box with all of his other toys. He really enjoys it, his favorite is the voice autotune. I purchased the entire matching set (guitar and piano). Great quality, toddler friendly. I would purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: treniece j watson

customer_reviews.title: Hopefully the only drum set I'll ever buy
customer_reviews.text: It was with great hesitancy that I bought a toddler drum set...who wants more noise creation devices in the house? Well, it turns out the volume isn't anything to worry about. I didn't think about it until I received it that it is more of a rhythm teaching device, with all the games on it. I sometimes catch my significant other playing the memory game, which really isn't all that different than a Simon. Great toy, good addition to the chest.
customer_reviews.author: J. Cook

customer_reviews.title: Great Gift!
customer_reviews.text: A Christmas gift for my grandson. He loved it! This is a portable unit and works well on any level surface. Seems to be well made and has a lot of features. My grandson is too young to fully understand all the features but this is a toy that he will be able to use for a long time. There are 2 AA batteries included. And there is a switch on the bottom which enables the volume to be turned up or down. Although it does make music, it is not extremely loud or annoying, even on the higher setting.
customer_reviews.author: D Frederick

customer_reviews.title: Love It!!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little mini drum set that my 1 year old absolutely loves! It has a bunch of different settings and the sound it produces keeps him entertained. Honestly, my wife and I love playing with it as well. It has a feature on it that works like the Simon memory game where you have to remember the order of each beat and follow along. We catch ourselves playing with it a lot! It doesn't take up much space, gives the feeling of playing the drums, entertains your child (and parents) and for the cost it is an awesome value! This is a must buy for your child!!
customer_reviews.author: RRACH

customer_reviews.title: I think if the volume was a little louder so they kids cud actually hear what their "playing" he may have liked it more
customer_reviews.text: Well bought this for my grandson who likes to play drums with my pots n pans... However this toy just didn't meet his 2yr old standards he played with it for abt 10 minutes n that was it. I think if the volume was a little louder so they kids cud actually hear what their "playing" he may have liked it more... The construction if the product is that that can be expected from VTEC as they always have rugged toys for kids, this one just didn't hold attention like a wooden spoon n a pot...
customer_reviews.author: Kristy Snyder

customer_reviews.title: ... big hit with my friend's 2 year old - easy for him to use - no assembly required - ...
customer_reviews.text: A big hit with my friend's 2 year old - easy for him to use - no assembly required - not very loud, which we all appreciated - the tips of the drumsticks are rubber rather than plastic (softer, less destructive) - super fun
customer_reviews.author: Angela

customer_reviews.title: Looks cool, sounds bad
customer_reviews.text: The pre-programmed music is annoying. There is a way to shut it off, but the percussive sounds themselves are tinny and hollow. It is basically just a noise-maker. This will drive you crazy very fast.
customer_reviews.author: J Ro

customer_reviews.title: Awesome toy for babies first Christmas!
customer_reviews.text: Our 8 month old got this for Christmas! I wanted something that could grow with him and be used more than a short while. He loves music & lights so at first it was more just him being facinated but now that he is almost one he likes to hit the drums and follow the color patterns! The toy is very nice quality and excellently priced!
customer_reviews.author: K.A

customer_reviews.title: Lots of fun
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my grandson who loves music and anything that makes noise. The drum set is very small, which is great for a little one. It's plastic, so if it's dropped it won't shatter to bits. Overall, it was perfect for the little guy. He enjoyed the sounds and the drums light up when they're hit with a hand or the drum sticks- which makes it interactive and interesting to little ones.
customer_reviews.author: MeliCjohnson

customer_reviews.title: Good for entertaining themselves and for cognitive stimulation
customer_reviews.text: This is quite small. I expected it to be a bit bigger (larger). But it's more compact. It's interactive and the kids have to have that attention span to listen to what it's asking you to do. It does have a lot of options for them. Good for entertaining themselves and for cognitive stimulation. I rate it a four only because of the size. I rate it a 5 for the overall of the item and the child I know who will use it.
customer_reviews.author: SDKVegas

customer_reviews.title: Do you want to get revenge on your grown kids?
customer_reviews.text: If you have a child that is now a parent and you want to remind that child just how much they annoyed you and drove you crazy when they were little, then here ya go! Unless they were super terrible then just go ahead and spend the $300 on a real drum kit. It's a great way to become grandmother of the year and punish your grown child at the same time! Grandson loved it, Daughter and Son In Law hated it. All together it was a Win/Win!
customer_reviews.author: Buffy555

customer_reviews.title: great toy
customer_reviews.text: works great. is noisy but not annoying noisy (others may feel different). very cute! bought early for christmas. cant wait to give it to kids. i had fun testing it! got frustration free packaging and wasnt sure what that was....just the drums in a small brown vtech box....easy to open...not a ton of trash. i recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: DKM

customer_reviews.title: Background vocal instructions is annoying.
customer_reviews.text: There is a background voice on every setting and it is very irritating. My 2 year old grandson can’t just play the drums without hearing his annoying instructions . I am definitely going to purchase a different drum set that he can just play without vocal interference. Its unfortunate because it’s the perfect size for him and is Very well made.
customer_reviews.author: F.C.

customer_reviews.title: Cheap and small
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 2.5 year old grandson just to see if he has interest in drumming. This little drum set (and I do mean little!) did nothing to spark his interest in drumming. (Maybe his mom and dad are glad.) It's certainly not very loud and the programs that come on with various buttons are hard to understand and bring no value. I'd suggest getting something larger that doesn't have unnecessary programming buttons.
customer_reviews.author: Christine Marie

customer_reviews.title: Fun for toddlers
customer_reviews.text: This was a Christmas gift for my 16-month old. He loves any kind of music. It's seems very durable as he sometimes picks it up and drops it on the floor. It is kind of annoying to listen to as a parent, but you get over that once you see your adorable kid having so much fun with it. Definitely a great gift for toddlers who like music or banging on things.
customer_reviews.author: Kitsey Burns Harrison

customer_reviews.title: A great purchase!
customer_reviews.text: I think this is great! I probably enjoy it more than my 1 year old. Haha I also got one for my niece for Christmas and her older brothers and dad were both enjoying it. There's a memory mode type that is really fun. I love how the dru. Sticks have soft tips. I was concerned about them before purchasing, so it was such a pleasant surprise that they are soft. They double as teethers hahaha
customer_reviews.author: Kansas momma

customer_reviews.title: MOST ANNOYING
customer_reviews.text: Terribly annoying, it constantly plays background music with a chattering high pitched male voice that “encourages” your child to drum. There is one hidden mode after pushing a specific button six (yes, six) times that turns off the cheap background music, but even then the voice does not go away and when you hit one drum it produces the sound of multiple beats.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Costa

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: My little one played with this for maybe 5 minutes. The voice is kind of obnoxious and once the child stops playing it keeps talking and encouraging activity for what seems like forever. It is practically demanding it be played with. The drumsticks are long gone, the "holder" in the back is loose so the sticks don't stay in it. It is a little confusing for my 18 month old because on the bottom three drums you tap the part that lights up but on the "cymbal" you are supposed to tap the ring around the part that lights up. Also, the set itself is tiny. Just altogether disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Taolan Meyers

customer_reviews.title: Good starter musical toy for your little ones
customer_reviews.text: This was a birthday present for my two year old grandson. It arrived on time. It was packaged well. My son sent me a video of my grandson opening and playing with the drum set. He seemed to love the drum set and was able to play with it immediately. It plays songs and makes noises that he really enjoyed.
customer_reviews.author: mlbean7

customer_reviews.title: We All Love This Little Toy
customer_reviews.text: This little drumset it awesome! Our son is currently a bit too young to understand how to play with it... but he loves dancing to the music & chewing on the drumsticks. Me & his dad have played with it... I'm sure most parents can relate, but I've gotta say it's a pretty good & cool toy! It even comes with batteries (that we noticed didn't last very long, but we're okay with that).
customer_reviews.author: Mr. & Mrs. Velasquez

customer_reviews.title: Not an attention getter or keeper.
customer_reviews.text: Was such a great toy that I had to get one for a family member's baby. And luckily found one since they were sold out of so many so quickly. But they then tried to overcharge for the second one. Then charged a shipping fee for the return of the double priced one. Was a rip off and hassle by the end of it all. ANd once we got to play with it, it was kind of stupid and my son only played with it for about 5 minutes before turning his attention to his kazoo and hot wheels, playing with both of those at the same time for hours. Meanwhile since then, he hasn't even looked in it's direction.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Kilkka

customer_reviews.title: Smaller then i thought but over all a great gift! Alot for child to learn
customer_reviews.text: Smaller then i thought but over all a great gift! Alot for child to learn! I even had the "big kid" playing with it for a while haha my nephew loves it! Hes obsessed!! Haha hes a year n half and cant stop playing with it! All in all great buybwe are all very happy with it!
customer_reviews.author: Sylvia

customer_reviews.title: Don’t mess with your older, wiser sister...she’ll buy your kid drums
customer_reviews.text: My brother bought his goddaughter drums for her birthday before he had children of his own. Then when they were “broken” he announced to my child the toy only needed batteries and fixed them. He has small children now and I needed to return the favor! Don’t forget extra batteries!
customer_reviews.author: MMAM

customer_reviews.title: Good childrens gift
customer_reviews.text: My three year old nephew loved this as did my adult cousin. Cute sound effects and easy to use for small children. Not too loud so it wouldn't annoy an audience, but perfect for a small child to listen to and play with. Was shipped on time and had decent packaging.
customer_reviews.author: lml193

customer_reviews.title: Fun for babies
customer_reviews.text: My 7-month-old thinks the orange drumsticks are the best thing ever, perfect for chewing. One star off because the "freestyle" option still plays a tune each time you stop free-styling. This seems to be the case on all electronic music instruments, but it is still unnecessary.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: So fun I even enjoy playing with it!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this for my 6month old and I know he loves it just as much as I do! He loves the lights, sounds, and just enjoys banging the sticks! There are a bunch of songs so it’s just not a couple to play with or listen to. It has a part where you can follow the lights to play along. And it came with batteries so I didn’t have to put any in. It was ready to go when we opened it! Which I appreciate lol The only dislike was the placement of the drum sticks on the back but they do attach so they don’t get misplaced. Overall an awesome toys!!
customer_reviews.author: Rosa

customer_reviews.title: My granddaughter loves it.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this several months back and held back from writing a review, considering how toddlers lose interest in toys from time to time. My granddaughter loves her drum set. She’ll spend a good amount of time playing her drums and with the variances in tempo that come with this, it keeps her entertained. I think we may have a future drummer on our hands. We love it!
customer_reviews.author: Christy Dee

customer_reviews.title: 2 year old enjoys
customer_reviews.text: My son received right around his 2nd birthday this year. He loves it. Nice that he figured out how to turn off and on by himself, though he doesn't much like any of the other settings that the toy has except for the free play. He isn't quite able to put the sticks in the holders in the back by himself, but that's not a big deal. Overall nice toy.. not to mention a wonderful alternative to the much louder sets available.
customer_reviews.author: Brenda B.

customer_reviews.title: Lots of great settings for two year olds and man does he ...
customer_reviews.text: Lots of great settings for two year olds and man does he love going to town on the drums. There is multiple settings and even a “play after me” setting that helps memory when he gets older. They also turn off by themselves if they haven’t been used in a few minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It looks like it could be a desktop drum set
customer_reviews.text: Now I know why this was such a low price, it is a very small set. It looks like it could be a desktop drum set. Debating on returning it. Not what I expected. If you order this just keep in mind it is definitely a “mini” drum set. Update returning it, decided to still gift it and it doesn’t work. Total FAIL as a bday gift for my niece. Bummer.
customer_reviews.author: LalaLanier

customer_reviews.title: Kids LOVED it
customer_reviews.text: I googled "most annoying toy for a 1 year old" and this popped up. So I got it for a friends daughters birthday present. It is super annoying, but you can turn the volume down. The kids all loved it, it is small too, I thought it would be huge but its perfect size for just sitting in her 1 year old lap.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsay

customer_reviews.title: Great product. Our toddler loves it
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Our toddler loves it. The only criticism is that on the "freestyle" setting it plays background music. Would have been nice if it didn't so your kid could only hear their own drumming.
customer_reviews.author: mr patrick woods

customer_reviews.title: Fun gift for my 2 year old!
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this item for Christmas and it has been such a hit (literally)! We chose frustration free packaging and it was such a breeze to have since I wrapped the box straight out of the shipping box it came in and when she opened it I had left one side I taped so she could pull out the toy. I really enjoyed that. As for the product itself, it’s fun, loud, the drumsticks have rubber ends and it’s all around a great toy to have!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Sound! Easy on the ears!!! Compact too
customer_reviews.text: Love this drum set! It is much smaller than I had expected (as I never read the dimension details) so I was very happily surprised that it doesnt take up much space! Will be great for travel too! Love the sound!!! It's just easy on the ears...but still pleasing for my 3 year old to bang on!
customer_reviews.author: Roxy

customer_reviews.title: I'm definitely glad I bought it
customer_reviews.text: My one year old enjoys playing with this. I'm definitely glad I bought it. You absolutely can make it so that you can just play the drums with no music, you just have to press the appropriate button a few times. It is a bit smaller than anticipated, but that probably a good thing because he enjoys walking around with it as much as he does playing with it.
customer_reviews.author: Alexandrea L Smith

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Toy
customer_reviews.text: 2 year old loves the drum set and we love the various modes it has (free play, counting, a-z). Construction of the "drums" is solid since the kid rarely uses the sticks. So far, the drums have been played with a glass, hands (mostly), other toys, and spoon. Lights are bright, sound is fairly loud (think there are settings to reduce it), and, overall, kid is really enjoying it.
customer_reviews.author: Anonnymouse

customer_reviews.title: Little Drummer Set
customer_reviews.text: My son loves this. He is always banging on things, like Im sure a lot of kids do. SO I wanted to get him a drum set, something for him to hit that at least puts out music. He will play with this all day long if I let him. Easy on/off button, different music setting. Perfect for him.
customer_reviews.author: J. White

customer_reviews.title: Cute and durable
customer_reviews.text: Nice and noisy. Just what I wanted in a gift for my nephew that is 2. LOL! I love giving kids noisy gifts. Update: This gift was a hit! Out of all the toys he got, this is the one he wanted to play with. Even his little friends wanted to play with it. Definitely appropriate for a 2 year old boy....and girl really!
customer_reviews.author: fotomakr

customer_reviews.title: Cheap garbage
customer_reviews.text: Package arrived looking like it was stepped on. Main drum cover completely detached - took a lot of work to get it together again, and still doesn't work. My 3-year-old played with it for about 10 minutes, and forgot it. Just another noisemaker, no real features, no feel to it, the sticks hitting the hard plastic drumheads are much louder than the sound it makes.
customer_reviews.author: Father of Four

customer_reviews.title: Not good
customer_reviews.text: The problem with this set is that in order to produce a sound when hit it needs to be switched on, and if you switch it on, there is music playing incessantly. Not only is this annoying, but it is difficult for the child to distinguish what he is producing when he bangs from the prerecorded music. Oh, and if you want to return it, you discover that the one "leg" you had to insert at the back is impossible to take out, and it now doesn't fit in the box. Just get the "Amazon Choice" - in this particular instance, there is logic to their decision.
customer_reviews.author: Warren

customer_reviews.title: She will love it! My 6 year old son even played ...
customer_reviews.text: Got for my 1 year old niece for Christmas. She will love it! My 6 year old son even played with it for a bit. He wanted to keep playing with it. I finally had to wrap it so he would leave it alone. Lol
customer_reviews.author: dustin

customer_reviews.title: Not annoying LOL
customer_reviews.text: My SIL purchased this as a payback for what I got her daughter for birthday (a whole band set every instrument you can think of) anyway it totally backfired for her. My son loves it and I love it because it's. It annoying at all. I did take the drumsticks away because he's one and was chewing them, but he operates it just fine with his hands. I like it it's really cute.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for grandson and Mom
customer_reviews.text: My 5-year-old grandson loves this! He received it for his birthday and plays on it daily, including in the van. His mom takes it along on short trips to keep him entertained. He loves the sounds and lights. She likes the portability. Even though this is listed for younger children, he loves to play on his drum set. Until someone makes a similar toy for older children, this will be well used.
customer_reviews.author: Grandma Lin

customer_reviews.title: Fun!
customer_reviews.text: My grandson will be 2 in a couple months. He had a blast beating on this! He likes music and this did the trick. I like that it has features that he can use when he's a little older too. He doesn't quite get all of the functions now, but he will before too long. I also like that I can adjust the volume. It's not obnoxiously loud even on high volume. I think this would be a great gift for any little one. Especially one that likes to bang on things.
customer_reviews.author: Deanna W.

customer_reviews.title: Good buy. Holds up well. Son loves it.
customer_reviews.text: My 3 year old uses it since Christmas, and bangs on the drums once in awhile. Although he did use it yesterday before I wrote this review. He has a lot of fun banging on them and he has not broken them yet (thank god). He is very prone to breaking every toy we get him...lol
customer_reviews.author: Mr. White

customer_reviews.title: Great gift for a 2 year old!
customer_reviews.text: We got this drum set for my son’s birthday. All his gifts were wrapped and we made the mistake of giving him the drum set first! He didn’t wanna open anything else! He just kept playing with it and when we tried to get him to open up his other gifts he would start to cry. Out of all his birthday gifts including a tablet he loves this drum set the most!
customer_reviews.author: Momma Key

customer_reviews.title: Received broken item TWICE
customer_reviews.text: WORST PURCHASE I'VE EXPERIENCED. I received a defective drum set. I replaced the batteries with new ones and they still didn't work. I asked for a NEW one in exchange. THEN I received ANOTHER broken item, with new batteries and everything! I will be returning both of these and not ordering another one. I PRAY this sort of thing does not happen with other christmas toys or I will have a serious problem with ordering from Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Kayla

customer_reviews.title: Unbeatable hit - 2 year old loves it
customer_reviews.text: Pardon the pun but this was a big HIT with the 2 year old we gifted with it. He understood immediately how to use it and loves it. It isn’t so loud as to drive nearby adults nuts but it responds satisfyingly for the child. I’ve already recommended it to others and for the price you can’t “beat” it.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia L.  Adams

customer_reviews.title: Almost Perfect
customer_reviews.text: This is a really great toy, especially since my husband's a drummer and the baby therefore has always loved drums. She uses it a lot, and I think will do so even more when she's older. I think the features are "too old" for her right now at 17 mos, but that's a good thing...she'll use this for a long time. Only bad thing is it will not stop/shut itself off even after several minutes of no use. It just keeps going and going....can't be good for battery, and it drives us crazy as the parents.
customer_reviews.author: Melanie M

customer_reviews.title: HIGHLY RECOMMENDED~! Lots of fun games and patterns to follow!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the VTech KidiBeats Drum Set for my daughter's 4th birthday because she loves musical instruments. I was a little concerned that she may not be too thrilled with these since they were not like her previous set of 'real' drums. I was wrong. In fact, she accidentally saw them the day before her birthday and ended up having to take them to daycare because she LOVED THEM! I especially like the fact that there is more to this drum set than just lights and sounds. There are patterns to follow, beats to learn and so mjch more! HIGHLY RECOMMEND for any small child!
customer_reviews.author: So Simply Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: Buttons and noise.
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for my Niece last Christmas and she loved it. Plenty of noise and buttons. I'm not sure what the age restriction is on this, but our 1 year old was having a blast with this toy too. Just take away the drumsticks and younger kids/toddlers would probably be fine playing with this toy.
customer_reviews.author: sarah82

customer_reviews.title: Great product - it has a volume control!
customer_reviews.text: Giving a drum set to a toddler is a risky adventure, thankfully this one has a volume level that is quiet enough to not disturb the whole house, but still satisfies the kid playing it. The games are great, I enjoy playing along with my daughter.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Burns

customer_reviews.title: Fun Fun For Everyone (Much Quieter Than a Real Drumset)
customer_reviews.text: As toy drums go this is not too bad. Right of the bat alot of people complain that you cannot turn off the accompaniment music that does play in freestyle mode. READ THE INSTRUCTIONS! It is there and can be done. Don't be fooled by the reviews that complain about this problem. This toy is definitely a great method for very young children to become introduced to the methods of rhythm and coordination. I stress though tha one should read the instructions completely and you will be happy with this item. An added measure is that your child will focus their love of hitting things on this toy rather than your walls, furniture, or pictures. Enjoy
customer_reviews.author: Deborah K. Gill

customer_reviews.title: Great gift for a toddler
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a gift for a 15 month old. Was a bit disappointed when it arrived to note that it was recommended for 2 years and older. Despite that this is an excellent item. The toddler can do more as they get older. It is not too noisy and the child loves it.
customer_reviews.author: kris

customer_reviews.title: 😎Awesome portable entertaining toy
customer_reviews.text: This would make a great toddler gift. Even my seven year old played with it. Doesn’t take up much space but still an impactful toy. Lightweight but doesn't tip over and would be portable, and sounds not annoying at all.
customer_reviews.author: Mom of four

customer_reviews.title: Very easy for them to hit and make a lot of ...
customer_reviews.text: Had one for my first boy now I bought another for my youngest, he Loves it! Very easy for them to hit and make a lot of "music" So all in all a great purchase, especially for that friend who got your kid a harmonica last year for Christmas.
customer_reviews.author: Robin C.

customer_reviews.title: An instant hit (pun intended)
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 1.5 year old niece and she instantly loved it. My 4.5 year old niece was immediately drawn to it as well so I think this will be used and enjoyed a lot by them. There is virtually zero assembly, other than snapping in one of the legs and it is also quite small so will not take up a lot of space. It comes with batteries but not sure how long they will last since the product section above states they are meant for demo purposes.
customer_reviews.author: IS

customer_reviews.title: Awesome toy!
customer_reviews.text: My nephew loves this toy. Easy to setup with so many options, he took to it right away and loved all of the sounds. It even has a mute button, so my nephew can continue playing when my sister can't take all of the noise anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Emma

customer_reviews.title: Excellent drum set toy
customer_reviews.text: This drum set makes such a great gift! My 2 year old loved it so much we gifted another one to his 2 year old cousin. I love the variety of settings to make unique music as well as the educational settings. My 1 year old loves to gnaw on the ends of the drumsticks and even after four months of it, there are literally zero signs of the chewing. I'm pretty impressed! Like some other reviews have said, it is a bit small, but a fun toy nonetheless!
customer_reviews.author: rayahss

customer_reviews.title: Nephew loved it!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for 1yo nephew and he loves it! Even his 10 & 11yo cousins had fun playing with it. There are different play options including a "Simon says" and free play setting. Of course parental supervision is needed with the drumsticks, but they aren't really needed to enjoy the drums.
customer_reviews.author: sandra

customer_reviews.title: Fun drum set!
customer_reviews.text: I have to say that it took about a month before my daughter would sit and play with this drum set. She was terrified of the man's voice that comes on. Eventually she got over it and it is her go to instrument!
customer_reviews.author: Lo

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME set for small children!
customer_reviews.text: I have this to my great-grandson and he loved it. The one thing you have to remember, is too turn the drum set "OFF", if you don't, your batteries will die and you'll think you've got a detective drum set.
customer_reviews.author: Maryann Harbison

customer_reviews.title: Nice Drum Toy
customer_reviews.text: I was really impressed with responsiveness and sounds of the drum pads. Definitely a fun toy to play with my son. I would have given it 5 stars, expect when playing in freestyle mode, the toy randomly does a drum roll pattern. From what I could tell, that couldn't be turned off. Considering there are other songs and activities on the toy, it seemed like a needless addition and one that is a little disruptive to freestyle playing.
customer_reviews.author: Mark B. Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Hello mini bam bam
customer_reviews.text: This is SO much smaller than we thought it would be! All of the drums are small than our toddler's head. Was a little disappointed. Plus, the sounds of each drum are not as diverse as I had hoped either.
customer_reviews.author: degarmeaux

product_meta.title: VTech KidiBeats Drum Set (Frustration Free Packaging)
product_meta.description: Color:Orange| Product Packaging:Frustration-Free PackagingPerform like a star with the KidiBeats Drum Set. Tap the three light-up drum pads and cymbal with the included drumsticks to hear each of their unique sounds for sensory development. Play along to built-in melodies in a variety of styles including rock, dance, pop or in your own style to encourage musical creativity. Four play modes include Free Play, Letters, Numbers and Follow Along.
feature_bullets: Kids learning toy has three drum pads and cymbal each with its own unique sound for sensory development
Toddlers can play along to 9 melodies in styles including rock, dance and pop; music toy teaches letters, numbers, and music
Kids drum set has 4 modes of play: free play, letters, numbers, and follow-along; each drum features a unique LED light
Educational kids toy includes two drumsticks; allow your child to feel like a real Drummer
Kids drums are intended for toddlers aged 2 to 5 years old; 3 AA batteries are included for demo, use new batteries for regular use

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars9,321 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
